name: slanger
text: What is "The Well"?  Is it made up?  Sorry if this question is something I should know.

name: shogun
text: It's an old-school (Started in 1985) online community...had message boards, email, stuff like that. Mostly discussions. It's owned by Salon now.  Still there if you want to take a look.  In this context, it's a really well-informed reference for somebody of Lil' Nephew's age group to be making.

name: slanger
text: oh cool!  The internet is all about learning.

name: the_doz
text: And porn. Well, mostly porn.

name: belgand
text: Indeed. If you were the sort of person who read Wired in the early to mid 90s when it was still reasonable to do so then you're probably at least familiar with The Well (Whole Earth 'Lectronic Link ... it was originally set up by the Whole Earth Catalog folks in San Francisco because, well, we are the Internets) even if you were never actually part of the community. It was trendy and very name-droppable. Basically one of the most famous BBSes ever.

name: tellumo
text: The WELL .

text: Youthful exhuberance is a poor substitute for natural skill tempered by experience.

milkpants
text: now i understand what the cat does with his knees. thank you.

name: milkpants
text: peek-a-boo thong

name: ninjaein
text: Ray's little dance sold me on this strip.  The last three panels are WIN.

name: tekende
text: Saying "____ is win" is, however, indisputably NOT win.

name: twntysevn27
text:
In the 2nd box, Ray's 2nd line, is clearly based on the rap group, UGK's song "Money, Hoes & Power" the last verse by Bun B;

"A high diver, with mo' tricks up my sleeve than ya boy MacGuyver
A conniver, that'll get cha' voted off my island like "Survivor""


It's good to see him being eclectic with his musical tastes, seeing as UGK is only the greatest rap act ever.

name: soticoto
text: Ray just botched his attack roll, no thanks to his -2 Thong of Epicfail. Lil' Nephew won't be needing a natural twenty to Crit that AC.

name: wulvaine
text: Is it sad that I'm enough of an RPG nerd that I understood all of that? I play pen and paper, AND I read Achewood. I'm getting my geek on. And proud of it.

name: soticoto
text:
Nerds and Geeks are not the same.
We are Geeks. Nerds don't D&D.
Life without D&D is like Summoning a Pit Fiend without Protection from Evil: a sign that you're getting way too close to the cold, sharp, slavering claws of reality.

name: charchar
text: I disagree: nerds and geeks of all persuasions can play D&D.  The geeks generally are victorious due to their ability to strategise, however. This is why I stopped playing chess.

name: foetus_punch
text: Charchar! I feel that you are a superior form of human being! You should...you should begin playing chess again! It would be a good thing .

name: charchar
text:
Teehee- I heard that in the same voice I imagine T-Rex from Dinosaur Comics using.

Also, thank you. Maybe I will * cue "Eye of the Tiger" *

name: foetus_punch
text: I got this shit! I got this shit you guys! We're fucking awesome!

name: foetus_punch
text: Oh god, I dropped some acid last night and said this. I am an asshole! A remarkably coherent drug asshole! But my statement about charchar still stands, don't worry. You are cool. Shall we be internet friends?

name: charchar
text: Your ability remain cogent while high both impresses and terrifies me.  Sure.

name: changuitotuerto
text: shit, i remember my dad showing me that dance when i was like 5

name: tekende
text: He wasn't wearing a thong, was he?

name: fallow_fields
text: I made this so long ago, but it appears I was the only one

name: sweetlips
text: This is epic.

name: jhunter
text: I await the day I bust out a retort so snappy that I can follow it up with the Charleston

name: dj_douche
text: Lil Nephew said "you think you can quell me?" in a rhyme battle. That is serious rhyming right there.

name: atypicaloracle
text: My second favorite part of Ray shuttin' down Lil' Nephew is that he pronounces it "Es-ka-laid" instead of "Es-ka-lahd" like rappers seem determined to do.
